channel.title: NEED HELP! Dropeditor related
channel.description:
i am trying to put a price checker/changer and a dropeditor into Rune-Evo v4 also known as Foxtrot Made By King Fox. if anyone can help id be happier then ever, this is something i wanna get into this source :)
thanks ahead of time for any help :D

item.title: NEED HELP! Dropeditor related
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

You can always just click on the single class and hit run…
You don’t have to make it a jar.

Read full topic

item.description:

Do you have the file “DropEditor.java” found in the folder com/foxtrot/tools/
?

yes i do, we went through that before when u asked
[/quote]
Then you should be able to export the single file into a jar…[/quote]

you try doing that and tell me how that goes lol i tried like i said and i get lost on what to do there is what i have already stated

item.title: NEED HELP! Dropeditor related
item.dc:creator: @Deathdomain Deathdomain
item.description:
@Deathdomain wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:15, topic:549814”][quote author=Deathdomain link=topic=668698.msg4471987#msg4471987 date=1423553297]

So…
I guess we’re back to square one here…

Do you have the code? OR the .jar file.

i have code
[/quote]
Okay… If the code is in it’s own project you can right click the project, hit export, and export it as a JAR. If you want to pack the required libs (libraries) into the jar, so you can run it by double clicking the jar… then make it a Runnable JAR. Otherwise, just make a regular one.
From there, do what I said:

[quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=668698.msg4471926#msg4471926 date=1423526716]
Oh okay. You’re loading it totally wrong. No offence. You didn’t know.

Step 1) Move the jar to your deps folder (or libs… whereever the other jars are…)

For this I’m using GiantAssProject.jar

Step 2) Go into eclipse and click the folder you put the jar into, and refresh by hitting F5. You should now see it in your folder.

(Mine has a question mark because my server is on github… Same goes for the yellow square things)

Step 3) Right click the jar, go to “Build Path” and hit “Add to build path”

(ignore that 2D array, I’m working on removing that)

Then from there you access it like any other jar file…
[/quote][/quote]

ok how am i doing this then cuz its not in its own project as far as i know its in my source and my source is in its own “java project” which has said code in it for the dropeditor as far as i know

Read full topic

item.title: NEED HELP! Dropeditor related
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Deathdomain, post:14, topic:549814”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=668698.msg4471985#msg4471985 date=1423550204]
So…
I guess we’re back to square one here…

Do you have the code? OR the .jar file.
[/quote]

i have code[/quote]
Okay… If the code is in it’s own project you can right click the project, hit export, and export it as a JAR. If you want to pack the required libs (libraries) into the jar, so you can run it by double clicking the jar… then make it a Runnable JAR. Otherwise, just make a regular one.
From there, do what I said:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:4, topic:549814”]Oh okay. You’re loading it totally wrong. No offence. You didn’t know.

Step 1) Move the jar to your deps folder (or libs… whereever the other jars are…)

For this I’m using GiantAssProject.jar

Step 2) Go into eclipse and click the folder you put the jar into, and refresh by hitting F5. You should now see it in your folder.

(Mine has a question mark because my server is on github… Same goes for the yellow square things)

Step 3) Right click the jar, go to “Build Path” and hit “Add to build path”

(ignore that 2D array, I’m working on removing that)

Then from there you access it like any other jar file…[/quote]

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Deathdomain Deathdomain
item.description:
@Deathdomain wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:10, topic:549814”]So then explain to me what you were trying to do way back here:

So… What part do you need help with? You didn’t mention that part. Making it? Putting the jar in the source? opening the jar from the server? what?
Read the first link in my sig and edit your post… Please. It’ll help everyone.

well everything really, i tried importing from Rune-Evo v3 but it seems not to work

this is what i get when i try to run it out of eclipse : http://prntscr.com/6378vl

this is what i get when i try to run it in eclipse: http://prntscr.com/637asb

just incase your wondering how im trying to run it in eclipse: http://prntscr.com/637a8w

EDIT: so with class part? ill accept any help from you sk8 if ur in a nice mood today’
EDIT: my revision is 718/753? i believe its basically the same as v3 of rune-evo and i have tried google but that didnt get me anywhere

Because I really don’t get how you had the files, but don’t.[/quote]

Me either but at the bottom is a photo of what im trying to achieve

[quote=“stCky, post:11, topic:549814”]sk8r is really trying to help you and you aren’t providing any helpful information, explain your problem, i.e “I want to edit the drops on my server”

i am trying to put a price checker/changer and a dropeditor into Rune-Evo v4

price checker/changer

Is price checker/changer something you use in game, or a program to check item prices and update them

and a dropeditor

is a drop editor something you use in game, or a program to check monster loot drops and update them?[/quote]

both are programs. its basically allows you to change dropped items by mobs with percentage, items number and the quanity of the item being dropped

price one allows you to change the prices of items so that it has the value you choose.

this is what its supposed to bring up http://prntscr.com/63a1e7 this is from a old source i found in my dropbox for a while back only get it downloaded now for
that photo to show yall waht im trying to achieve

Read full topic

item.description:
@Deathdomain wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:4, topic:549814”]Oh okay. You’re loading it totally wrong. No offence. You didn’t know.

Step 1) Move the jar to your deps folder (or libs… whereever the other jars are…)

For this I’m using GiantAssProject.jar

Step 2) Go into eclipse and click the folder you put the jar into, and refresh by hitting F5. You should now see it in your folder.

(Mine has a question mark because my server is on github… Same goes for the yellow square things)

Step 3) Right click the jar, go to “Build Path” and hit “Add to build path”

(ignore that 2D array, I’m working on removing that)

Then from there you access it like any other jar file…[/quote]

ummmmm i dont have a .jar for dropeditor for some reason i think,i mean i tried launching rune-evo v3 dropeditor in that source and it worked, then i searched for dropeditor in that folder and i couldnt find any .jar to transfer or even in the source im using now v4 but ill keep looking, if u wanna help more id appericate it and give credit if i advertise for helping get this working

item.title: NEED HELP! Dropeditor related
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Oh okay. You’re loading it totally wrong. No offence. You didn’t know.

Step 1) Move the jar to your deps folder (or libs… whereever the other jars are…)

For this I’m using GiantAssProject.jar

Step 2) Go into eclipse and click the folder you put the jar into, and refresh by hitting F5. You should now see it in your folder.

(Mine has a question mark because my server is on github… Same goes for the yellow square things)

Step 3) Right click the jar, go to “Build Path” and hit “Add to build path”

(ignore that 2D array, I’m working on removing that)

Then from there you access it like any other jar file…

Read full topic
